str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To remind, remember, call to mind. From hupo and mimnesko; to remind quietly, i.e. Suggest to the memory.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From phluaros; to be a babbler or trifler, i.e. to berate idly or mischievously.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To keep off, assist; I suffice; pass: To be satisfied. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to ward off, i.e. to avail.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To accept, admit, welcome. From epi and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) teacher.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To prevent, debar, hinder; with infin: from doing so and so. From the base of kolazo; to estop, i.e. Prevent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
